source.author: Thompson, I.R
source.title: Taxonomic studies of Australian Senecio (Asteraceae): 1. The disciform species.
source.citation: From: Thompson, I.R (2004a). Taxonomic studies of Australian Senecio (Asteraceae): 1. The disciform species.. Muelleria 19:101-214.

leads.lead_text: Cypselas less than one third of involucral bract length (involucral bracts 4.0–6.0 mm long; cypselas 1.0–1.7 mm long), cypselas commonly all medium to dark red-brown; pappus usually greater than 5 mm long

Cypselas greater than one third of involucral bract length (involucral bracts 3.0–5.0 mm long; cypselas 1.3–2.2 mm long), marginal cypselas greenish or olive, others medium brown; pappus usually less than 5 mm long
